A group of artists and collectors are organizing a fundraiser for the Baltimore Museum of Art (BMA) in honor of the victims of the unrest that took place in the city last summer. The event, which will be held at the museum from September 19 to September 21, will feature artworks and projects that were created by people, institutions, and organizations who were affected by the unrest, as well as artworks that have not yet been exhibited. The event is organized by the Artists’ Legacy Fund and will be hosted by the BMA’s new organization, Baltimore Art + Soul. “The BMA is benefiting from the generosity of our donors and partners across the city, including the William P. Bradley Foundation, the Arthur M.
